title: Mother 'told 4 kids to unbuckle seat belts so she could crash car and kill them'
text:
Calicia Williams is said to have told her children to unbuckle their seat belts, then hold out their hands so she could crash her car into a tree and kill them. All four youngsters survived the subsequent smash (Pictures: News4Jax)

A mother told her four children to take off their seat belts and hold out their hands so she could crash into a tree and kill them, police say.

Calicia Williams, 36, reportedly slammed her white minivan a the palm tree in Lake City, Florida, in a deliberate bid to murder her young family on Wednesday, police say.

She kept her seat belt on for the impact, it is claimed, with one of Williams’ daughters telling police about their mother’s twisted scheme while being rushed by ambulance to hospital.

The girl added that her mother had been speeding before the moment of impact, and had ignored her frightened children’s requests to slow down.

All four of Williams’ youngsters’, who are aged seven to 13, survived the horror crash, and were taken to hospital where they remain in a stable condition.

The mother was conscious when first responders arrived at the scene, and is said to have told them that her husband had put a hex on her.

Williams – who has now been charged with four counts of attempted murder – is also said to have claimed she was being followed, and spoke of casting spells and voodoo.

After the crash, the mother is said to have told her children: ‘The devil can’t hurt you; he only hurts bad people.

‘You have the light of Jesus in you and only Jesus can cure us.’

She is also said to have admitted having marijuana in her system.

Williams will be charged with four counts of attempted murder when she is released from hospital (Picture: News4Jax)

Family friend Julie Rogers was among those stunned to hear of the allegations against Williams.

She told News4Jax: ‘I was in complete shock of how this could ever happen.

‘She is one of the nicest people I have ever met.

‘She works really hard and she takes very good care of her kids.’

Rogers added that Williams had treated her children to a trip to their local ice rink last Friday.

The mother will be booked into jail after being released from hospital, with sheriff’s deputies requesting that she be held without bond.
description: Calicia Williams of Lake City in Florida kept her own seat belt on after slamming her car into a tree
